To: All Undergraduate Students
Re: Recommendations on Grade Averages Computation and Honors Classification

Dear Students

The Senate Committee on Undergraduate Studies (CUS) commissioned a task force to review the policies on grade average calculation and degree classification in 2016. A proposal of the new rules in computing cumulative grade averages for graduation and determining honor classification of the Undergraduate Studies has recently been prepared, and is being discussed by CUS and presented to the University community including faculty and students for consultation.

I had an initial talk to the representatives of the Executive Committee of HKUST Students’ Union on the related issues. It was welcome that before a final proposal is to be worked out, it will be helpful to solicit more students’ views and inputs. With the help of the Students’ Union, a briefing session will be held with the following details:

Date: 9 March 2017 (Thursday)
Time: 4:00pm to 5:00pm
Venue: LT- F, Academic Concourse (near Lift 25-26)

All undergraduate students are welcome to join. I will explain the proposal in details and answer questions. You may also send in your comments to aptl@ust.hk in advance.

I look forward to your participation.


Yours sincerely


Prof Roger Cheng
Associate Provost (Teaching & Learning)
Secretary of CUS

Btw咩叫nation state google 左d都唔明

Hong Kong is a national state. Guangzhou may sometimes also a nation state, depending on how you define on it.
Usually refer to a political unit with people sharing similar cultures, language etc. (need not be a country of itself)

唔好鳩up 啦

nation=民族，或者你可以理解做國族，通常有共同：
1。歷史（或者信史）
2。語言
3。風俗／生活方式
4。宗教
5。種族
（當然唔係個個條件都齊先叫做nation，好多nation都未必有齊以上條件）

Nation = country

pol sci/sociology嚟講通常唔用country呢個字嘅，
因為嗰啲有啲闊，但大概黎講同state一樣，係解一個political entity
而nation係一個cultural identity，例如palestinean有自己嘅1,2,3,4,5，而佢哋都認為自己要有一個國家，咁palestinean就係一個nation，但現實佢哋又立唔到國喎，所以佢哋就無一個state。

所以nation係唔等於country/state嘅，nation係Culural identity而state係Political identity／fact
